did.unittitle: Winslow H. Hartford collection of materials related to Mutual Chemical Company of America and chromium chemistry

bioghist.p: Winslow H. Hartford (b. 1910) received his bachelors degree from Boston University in 1928, and his Ph.D. in inorganic chemistry from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1933. He worked as a research supervisor with the Mutual Chemical Company of America from 1934-58. He later worked at Allied's Syracuse Technical Center as a senior scientist, and then took a position as associate professor of chemistry at Belmont Abbey College. From 1979 until his death in 1997, he was Professor Emeritus at Belmont. He specialized in the chemistry and technology of chromium, and in wood preservation.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of documents related to the history of Mutual Chemical Company, and chromium chemistry. Mutual Chemical Company of America operated from 1845 to 1954 and was at one time the largest chrome manufacturer in the world. In 1954, Mutual was purchased by Allied Chemical. Included are a chronology of the history of the company, a brief history of the company written in 1945, a printed copy of "A Course in Chromium Chemistry" given by Hartford at Mutual in 1948, a 1984 manuscript copy of a report by Hartford entitled "A Systems Analysis of the Baltimore Chromium Chemicals Plant," a brief history of the Baltimore plant entitled "An Introduction to Baltimore Works," and correspondence regarding his work on the environmental considerations of the Mutual chromium production plants.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
